intro: Elephantopus angolensis, commonly known as African dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring serrated leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in open grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional medicinal uses in local communities.
